titleInfo.title: Freddie Smith Jr. oral history interview

mods.abstract: In this brief interview, Smith recalls his experiences as a student at McKinley from 1959 to 1963. He describes a typical day's schedule, his participation in sports, the emphasis on academics, and his academic achievements. He talks about his favorite teacher, Mildred Cummings, recalls community involvement at McKinley, names some prominent graduates, and discusses McKinley's influence on Baton Rouge.
mods.note: This collection includes materials accessioned as Mss. 4700.0690; A digital version of the transcript (pdf) exists for duplication purposes; A digital version of the audio recording (mp3) exists for duplication purposes and public access in the Special Collections Reading Room; Interview conducted by Shanta Jenkins and Carmen Posey.

Freddie Smith Jr. was born in New Orleans, La., in 1945 to Freddie and Estelle Smith. He attended McKinley High School from 1959 through 1963 and went on to Grambling College (now Grambling State University), where he received a degree in Recreation. After college, he worked at the Exxon Refinery in Baton Rouge for fifteen years, and then worked as a lab technician at Ciba-Geigy in St. Gabriel. He is married to Patricia Haynes Smith and they have six children.

physicalDescription.extent: 1 digital audio file (11 minutes); Transcript (9 leaves)

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). T. Harry Williams Center for Oral History
